instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1466: What is A1466? A1466 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Air from years Early 2015, 2017, Mid 2012, Mid 2013, Early 2014 with EMC 2925, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00165, 820-3209, 820-3437..
definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .
definitions.EDP_BKLT_PWM: What is EDP_BKLT_PWM? EDP_BKLT_PWM sets the brightness of the screen. The system will send a PWM signal to BKL_PWM pin to set brightness. If this is low, backlight voltage will boost higher than PPBUS_G3H input, but not enough to make the screen light properly..
definitions.Q7706: What is Q7706? Q7706 takes PPBUS_G3H's main 12.6v and sends it through to the backlight circuit. If Q9706 is not allowing PPBUS_G3H through, you will get no voltage on the backlight circuit. Q7706 is a P channel MOSFET, meaning power will flow through it when the voltage on the gate is lower than on the source. Look at pin 3. R7788 takes the 12.6v that is on the source and places it right on pin 3. This will set Q7706 to "off", and not allow it to pass power, as the voltage on the source and the gate are identical..
definitions.D7701: What is D7701? diode in the backlight circuit sitting between the BKL_SW pin of the LED driver and backlight output. Very common for via between this and BKL_FB for feedback to blow, causing no boost. Measure continuity between pin 2 of this diode and feedback pin of LED driver if backlight output is PPBUS_G3H with no boost.
definitions.BKL_EN: What is BKL_EN? BKL_EN enables backlight. Anytime you see a signal ending with “_EN” , that means this signal being present/high enables what it is referring to. This signal says “BKL” before “_EN”. “BKL” sounds short for “BACKLIGHT”, so it is safe to assume this signal enables backlight when present. .
definitions.BKL_PWM: What is BKL_PWM? BKL_PWM sets the brightness of the screen. The system will send a PWM signal to BKL_PWM pin to set brightness. If this is low, backlight voltage will boost higher than PPBUS_G3H input, but not enough to make the screen light properly..
definitions.LCDBKLT_EN_L: What is LCDBKLT_EN_L? This signal enables the backlight when it is low.  _L means the signal asserts itself when the voltage is low. This signal needs to be low to enable backlight. .

threads.title: FIXED <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A backlight problem
threads.message:
only backlight flash for second then turns off
mother board is already repaired
backlight fuse shorted and  J8300 due burn out replaced 
I  reset PRAM 3 times , replaced <CHIP>U7701</CHIP> and <TRANSISTOR>Q7706</TRANSISTOR> but not fixed
<SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> is good 3.3v
<SIGNAL>EDP_BKLT_PWM</SIGNAL> 1.47v
<SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> 3.42v
any suggestions ?

threads.message:
"J8300 due burn out"
LCD cable wasn't affected?
Did you test with known good LCD assembly?
Did you check XW7720 continuity?

threads.title: FIXED <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A backlight problem
threads.message:
Check <SIGNAL>BKL_EN</SIGNAL>/PWM (<CHIP>U7701</CHIP> side).
Be sure <DIODE>D7701</DIODE> is not shorted A-K.
Post <TRANSISTOR>Q7706</TRANSISTOR>/7 voltages.

threads.title: FIXED <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A backlight problem
threads.message:
"<TRANSISTOR>Q7706</TRANSISTOR>  ALL pin 8.56V"
So is damaged, requires low voltage on pin 3; change it.

I have doubts about <TRANSISTOR>Q7707</TRANSISTOR>, or the posted readings.
Check <RESISTOR>R2088</RESISTOR> and post <CHIP>U2071</CHIP> voltages.

2  1.03v"
This looks strange, don't you think?

Post again <TRANSISTOR>Q7706</TRANSISTOR>/7 voltages.

You may have bad solders for <CHIP>U7701</CHIP>.
Post diode mode to ground on all its connections.
Use surrounding components as test points.

threads.title: FIXED <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A backlight problem
threads.message:
<TRANSISTOR>Q7706</TRANSISTOR>'s pin 3 should have much lower voltage; aprox 2V only.
Just in case, remove <CAPACITOR>C7782</CAPACITOR> and check again.
Be sure to solder <TRANSISTOR>Q7706</TRANSISTOR> in correct orientation.
Is the replacement used P-channel MOSFET for sure?

threads.message:
Please, calculate Vout (<SIGNAL>LCDBKLT_EN_DIV_L</SIGNAL>) voltage of <RESISTOR>R7788</RESISTOR>/89.
Consider <SIGNAL>LCDBKLT_EN_L</SIGNAL> is 0V and Vin=8.4V (PPVIN_S0SW_LCDBKLTFET) (as you've mentioned before).
I can't get 7.9V myself...

i replaced all comunents above one time the pin 3 for <TRANSISTOR>Q7706</TRANSISTOR>  is now 2.8v
also only  backlight  flash  millisecond then turns off

threads.title: FIXED <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A backlight problem
threads.message:
Disconnect the webcam and test again; including KB backlight.

Why to force?
You've said to have 0V at pin 3/<TRANSISTOR>Q7707</TRANSISTOR>; change it, if in doubts.

threads.title: FIXED <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A backlight problem
threads.message:
I disconnect everything and replace charging board and its flat cable ,touch-pad  fcc test other good working lcd assembly everything ok else no backlight when i close lid then open it backlight flashed then turns off
i replaced <CHIP>U7701</CHIP> with new one
<SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> 3.3v
<SIGNAL>EDP_BKLT_PWM</SIGNAL> 2.49v
<SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> 3.42v
pin 3 for <TRANSISTOR>Q7707</TRANSISTOR>  is 0v now
what to test else?

threads.title: FIXED <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A backlight problem
threads.message:
"pin 3 for <TRANSISTOR>Q7707</TRANSISTOR>  is 0v now"
Was it before too; but you didn't get correct <SIGNAL>LCDBKLT_EN_DIV_L</SIGNAL>.
That's really strange.

Be sure to have good continuity between <TRANSISTOR>Q7706</TRANSISTOR> and L7701; check <RESISTOR>R5490</RESISTOR>, if exists.

If backlight flashes one time, means <CHIP>U7701</CHIP> boosts, but detects some problem and stops.
Usually XW7720 may cause this.
Check continuity from ball A5/<CHIP>U7701</CHIP> to <DIODE>D7701</DIODE>'s cathode.
Also check the value of all return resistors (<RESISTOR>R7717</RESISTOR>-22); be sure to have good solders and traces.

threads.title: FIXED <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A backlight problem
threads.message:
the continuity between <TRANSISTOR>Q7706</TRANSISTOR> and L7701 is perfect
<RESISTOR>R5490</RESISTOR> not exist just track onboard
i replaced <DIODE>D7701</DIODE> not fix the problem
i replaced L7701 the issue fixed! :)
L7701 swollen and expolded from the underside .
